title: Allied Cycleworks Able 2 Clears a 57 MM Tire
content:
Today, Allied has officially launched the next-generation Able gravel bike. This from the ground up redesigned race machine received a whole new carbon fiber chassis. Featuring clearance for 57mm tires, fully integrated cabling, internal frame storage, and three premium SRAM builds, the new Able raises the bar for the brand’s offerings…

Allied Able 2 Quick Hits

  • Frame: $4500
  • Completes:
    • Rival $6775
    • Force: $8400
    • Red: $11500
  • Sizes: 52 – 61 cm
  • 12 paint options
  • Made in Asia
  • Maximum clearance 700 x 57 mm Wide
  • Bottle mounts downtube, Seat Tube and Top Tube bag
  • Chainstay length: 435mm
  • Drivetrain: Built for 1x Wireless Drivetrains
  • Geometry Gravel race geometry. Big tires, single track capable, but designed for speed and pack racing.
  • Storage: Lightweight and easy to access in-frame storage including stow bag.

Geometry

Able Key Detail

Keen eyes will pick up on the lowered chainstay, compared to the raised stay on the original bike. The brand’s engineers knew that fitting the largest tire possible on the new model was essential — in this case, 700 x 57 mm width — to give riders the ability to monster truck through rough and rugged terrain.

Check out more at Allied.
